Could we possibly stay on topic and discuss embryonic development rather than archie? Please?
 
 OK, so, where's the big deal?
 
 Developing foetuses of various species do develop in similar ways. Historic drawings aside, modern actual photos show the similarities.
 
 Some scientists have tried to make out more than is really there and worked out the Recapitulation theory, however, modern thought generally does not accept it, but only notices some basic common principles seen in developing embryos.
 
 And Haeckel himself actually falsified some of his drawings (not all) to make it look as if the common elements were far more pronounced, and got called out on it by other scientists. 
 
 Modern evolutionary theory has refuted the Recapitulation theory, so little can be made of it.
 
 
 So: yeah, it happened, but it's not part of the modern evolutionary theory and accusations against it can not be applied to evolutionary theory. Note that this is not evolutionary theory "hiding" or "running away" from a weak spot - the nature of science is that if a better explanation is found, it will replace older explanations. Note that while early evolutionary research yielded some quite inaccurate theories, these have due to the scientific process been refuted. What is left is rather solid and fits well with the evidence.

 BTW - it is ironic that the website whose mission is to promote the truth of the Bible would manipulate evidence to convince its followers that evolutionists are immoral in their unjustified fight to promote the religion of evolution. Further, they are simply lying in many instances. Please notice that the drawings, though the older ones are fairly accurate and reasonable for given the time they were done, are not the same. There are obvious differences and any similarities can be attributed to the drawings being based on the same subject matter. This website has rotated, re-sized, and completely rearranged Haekel's drawings.
